tuv.seg: The Constitution recognises and declares that people living in Ireland have certain fundamental personal rights
Aithnítear agus fógraítear sa Bhunreacht go bhfuil cearta bunúsacha pearsanta áirithe ag daoine a chónaíonn in Éirinn
These rights may be derived or implied from the Constitution
D’fhéadfaí na cearta seo a dhíorthú nó a chur in iúl ón mBunreacht
The Courts decide what the Constitution means
Déanann na Cúirteanna cinneadh air sin a bhíonn i gceist sa Bhunreacht
Fundamental rights are not absolute – they can be limited or restricted by the Oireachtas on the grounds, for example, of the common good
Níl cearta bunúsacha dearbh – is féidir leis an Oireachtas iad a theorannú nó a chosc ar bhunúis an leasa choitinn, mar shampla
Ireland has agreed to follow the terms of 4 international treaties which lay out standards for the treatment of prisoners
Chomhaontaigh Éire chun cloí le téarmaí 4 chonradh idirnáisiúnta ina leagtar amach na caighdeáin chun caitheamh le príosúnaigh
• European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR)
• An Coinbhinsiún Eorpach um Charta an Duine (ECHR)
• European Convention for the Prevention of Torture and Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment
• An Coinbhinsiún Eorpach maidir le Cosc ar Chéasadh agus ar Íde agus ar Phionós ata Mídhaonna nó Táireach
• International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR)
• Cúnant Idirnáisiúnta ar Chearta Sibhialta agus Polaitiúla (ICCPR)
• Convention against Torture and Other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment (CAT)
• An Coinbhsiún i gcoinne Céasadh agus i gcoinne Íde nó Pionós EEIle atá Cruálach, Mídhaonna nó Táireach (CAT)
There is also the Council of Europe’s European Prison Rules which give guidance on standards for prisons
Anuas air sin, tá Rialacha Príosúin na hEorpa de chuid Chomhairle na hEorpa ann ina dtugtar treoir maidir le caighdeáin do phríosúin
The main source of prisoners’ rights is the Prison Rules 2007 as amended
Is í príomhfhoinse cearta príosúnach Rialacha na bPríosún, 2007 arna leasú
The following is an overview of how prison affects the daily life and associated rights of an individual
Seo a leanas forbhreathnú ar conas a imríonn an príosún tionchar ar shaol laethúil agus ar chearta gaolmhara duine aonair
The courts have not yet decided that you have a right to marry while you are in prison
Ní dhearna na cúirteanna an cinneadh go fóill go bhfuil an ceart chun pósta agat fad atá tú i bpríosún
Right to procreate and/or conjugal rights
An ceart chun tuismithe agus/nó cearta comhchuingithe
You do not have a right to temporary release or conjugal visits
Níl an ceart agat go scaoilfear go sealadach thú nó go dtugtar cuairteanna comhchuingithe ort
If you are married, you have a right to communicate with your spouse, but without privacy
Má tá tú pósta, tá an ceart agat cumarsáid a dhéanamh le do chéile, ach gan phríobháideacht a bheith agaibh
You also have a right to take some part in the education of your children
Anuas air sin, tá an ceart agat chun páirt áirithe a ghlacadh in oideachas do leanaí
You have a right to be registered in the political constituency where you would normally live if you were not in prison
Tá an ceart agat a bheith cláraithe sa toghcheantar polaitiúil a mbeadh gnáthchónaí ort ann mura mbeifeá i bpríosún
However, you have no right to be given physical access to a ballot box by temporary release
Níl aon cheart agat, áfach, rochtain fhisiciúil a fháil ar bhosca ballóide trí scaoileadh sealadach
If you happen to be on parole or temporary release at the time of an election, you are free to vote where you are registered
Má tharlaíonn go mbíonn tú ar parúil nó ar scaoileadh sealadach ag tráth toghcháin, is féidir leat vóta a chaitheamh san áit a bhfuil tú cláraithe
Your rights if you are on remand are the same as if you were a convicted prisoner
Is ionann do chuid ceart má tá tú ar athchur agus más príosúnach ciontaithe thú
The Electoral (Amendment) Act 2006 provides procedures that enable prisoners to vote by post
Soláthraítear nósanna imeachta san Acht Toghcháin (Leasú), 2006 a chuireann ar chumas príosúnach chun vóta a chaitheamh sa phost
If you are in prison, you can register for a postal vote in the area that you would otherwise be living in
Má tá tú i bpríosún, féadfaidh tú clárú do vóta poist sa cheantar ina mbeifeá i do chónaí mura raibh tú i bpríosún
If you are already registered to vote in that area and wish to be able to vote from prison then you should fill out a form called Form RFG
Má tá tú cláraithe le vóta a chaitheamh cheana féin sa cheantar sin agus más mian leat bheith in ann vóta a chaitheamh ón bpríosún, ba cheart duit foirm ar a dtugtar Foirm RFG a chomhlánú
If you are not already on the register then you should complete Form RFA4 as well
Mura bhfuil tú ar an gclár cheana féin, ba cheart duit Foirm RFA4 a chomhlánú chomh maith
These application forms are available in all prisons and should be sent to the local authority for your area
Tá na foirmeacha iarratais seo ar fáil i ngach príosún agus ba cheart iad a sheoladh chuig an údarás áitiúil i do cheantar
You have a right to communicate with other prisoners while you are working or at recreation
Tá sé de cheart agat caidreamh a dhéanamh le príosúnaigh eile fad atá tú ag oibriú nó i mbun caitheamh aimsire
However, you must communicate in an orderly way and you cannot impede the other prisoners' work
Ní mór duit cumarsáid a dhéanamh ar bhealach ordúil, áfach, agus ní féidir leat srian a chur ar obair na bpríosúnach
The governor of the prison can take away this right in the interest of good order in the prison
Is féidir le gobharnóir an phríosúin an ceart seo a bhaint díot ar mhaithe dea-ord sa phríosún
You have a limited right to privacy
Tá ceart teoranta chun príobháideachta agat
For example, you may not to be stripped, searched or bathed in the presence of another prisoner
Mar shampla, ní féidir thú a nochtadh, a chuardach nó a fholcadh i láthair príosúnaigh eile
In addition, you have the right to be exposed to the public view as little as possible while being removed from or to prison
Anuas air sin, tá an ceart agat go nochtfar thú a laghad don phobal fad atá tú á aistriú isteach nó amach ó bpríosún
However, you may be photographed
Mar sin féin, féadtar grianghraif a ghlacadh díot
Your right to privacy may be limited for security reasons
D’fhéadfadh do cheart chun príobháideachta a bheith teoranta mar gheall ar chúiseanna slándála
Rights relating to searches and drug testing
Cearta maidir le cuardaigh agus tástáil drugaí
You may be searched and you may only be searched by officers of the same sex
Is féidir thú a chuardach agus ní féidir ach le hoifigigh den ghnéas céanna thú a chuardach
The search must be done with due regard to your decency and self-respect and in as appropriate a manner as possible
Ní mór an cuardach a dhéanamh agus an aird cheart á tabhairt ar do gheanas agus d’fhéinmheas agus ar an mbealach is oiriúnaí agus is féidir
At no stage should you be left completely naked
Níor cheart thú a fhágáil go hiomlán nocht ag aon tráth
You might have to give a hair, urine or saliva sample for the purpose of detecting the presence or use of alcohol, a controlled drug or a medicinal product
B’fhéidir go mbeidh ort sampla gruaige, fuail nó seile a thabhairt ar mhaithe le láithreacht nó úsáid alcóil, druga rialaithe nó táirge leighis a bhrath
A search can only be carried out for a genuine purpose, for example, to find forbidden items
Ní féidir cuardach a dhéanamh mura bhfuil fíorchúis leis, mar shampla, chun cuardach a dhéanamh ar ábhair nach bhfuil ceadaithe
A search cannot be carried out simply to harass you
Ní féidir thú a chuardach díreach ar mhaithe le thú a chiapadh
Right to freedom from discrimination
An ceart chun saoirse ó idirdhealú
You have the same right to freedom from discrimination as any other citizen
Tá an ceart céanna agat chun saoirse ó idirdhealú atá ag aon saoránach eile
If you are involved in indoor work at the prison, you are entitled to daily exercise in the open air for one hour or more
Má ghlacann tú páirt in obair taobh istigh ag an bpríosún, tá tú i dteideal tabhairt faoi aclaíocht laethúil faoin aer ar feadh uair an chloig nó níos mó
Where possible, you must be provided with access to indoor space and equipment, suitable for physical recreation, exercise or training
Sa chás gur féidir, ní mór rochtain a sholáthar duit ar spás agus trealamh taobh istigh, atá oiriúnach le haghaidh caitheamh aimsire, aclaíocht nó oiliúint fhisiciúil
You do not have the right to keep money in prison
Níl an ceart agat chun airgead a choimeád i bpríosún
You are not allowed to keep all the money and effects you brought into the prison or were sent to the prison for your use
Ní cheadaítear duit an t-airgead agus na hearraí go léir a choimeád a thug tú leat isteach sa phríosún nó a seoladh chuig an bpríosún go mbainfidh tú úsáid astu
They will be placed in the custody of the governor, who will keep an inventory of them
Coimeádfar iad faoi choimeád an ghobharnóra, a choimeádfaidh fardal díobh
The money will be lodged into an account for your use
Cuirfear an t-airgead i dtaisce i gcuntas a mbeidh tú in ann úsáid a bhaint as
Right to bodily integrity
An ceart chun corpiomláine
You have a limited right to bodily integrity
Tá ceart teoranta chun corpiomláine agat
For example, a prisoner's hair cannot be cut without their consent unless the prison doctor considers it necessary on health grounds
Mar shampla, ní féidir gruaig phríosúnaigh a ghearradh mura dtugann siad toiliú, mura measann dochtúir an phríosúin go bhfuil gá léis ar bhunúis sláinte
Right to earn a livelihood
An ceart chun slí mhaireachtála a thuilleamh
You do not have a right to run a business or earn a livelihood from prison
Níl an ceart agat chun gnólacht a reáchtáil nó chun slí mhaireachtála a thuilleamh ón bpríosún
Right to freedom of religion
An ceart chun saoirse reiligiúin
You do have a right to practise your religion
Tá an ceart agat chun do reiligiún féin a chleachtadh
The prison will provide for basic religious needs but you do not have a right to special requirements
Freastalóidh an príosún ar riachtanais bhunúsacha reiligiúnacha ach níl an ceart agat riachtanais speisialta a fháil
When you arrive in prison, you will state your religious denomination and if there is no service provided in the prison for your denomination, the prison will allow a religious instructor visit you

Nuair a théann tú isteach i bpríosún, luafaidh tú do shainchreideamh agus mura bhfuil aon seirbhís ar fáil do do shainchreideamh, ceadóidh an príosún go dtabharfaidh teagascóir reiligiúnach cuairt ort
While you are in prison, you must be given a healthy, well balanced and reasonably varied diet
Fad atá tú i bpríosún, ní mór go dtabharfar cothú sláintiúil, dea-chothromaithe agus réasúnta éagsúil duit
Where possible, provision is made to enable a prisoner to observe the dietary practices of their religion or culture
Sa chás gur féidir, déantar foráil lena chur ar chumas príosúnaigh chun cloí le cleachtais chothaithe a reiligiúin nó a gcultúir
The prison medical officer can approve a change of diet
Is féidir le hoifigeach leighis an phríosúin athrú cothaithe a fhaomhadh
You have a right to education while you are in prison
Tá ceart chun oideachais agat fad a bhíonn tú i bpríosún
The child of a female prisoner can be taken into the prison to facilitate breast feeding, until the child is 12 months of age
Is féidir leanbh príosúnaigh bhaininn a thabhairt isteach sa phríosún chun cothú cíche a éascú, go dtí mbaineann an leanbh 12 mhí d’aois amach
The child may not be taken from its mother until the medical officer certifies that it is in a fit condition to be removed
Ní féidir an leanbh a thógáil ón máthair go dtí go ndeimhníonn an t-oifigeach leighis go bhfuil an bhail cheart ar an leanbh agus gur féidir é/í a bhaint den mháthair
Except in special circumstances, the child will not be kept in the prison after it is 12 months old
Seachas faoi chúinsí speisialta, ní choimeádfar an leanbh sa phríosún i ndiaidh gur bhain sé/sí 12 mhí d’aois amach
Before taking a child out of prison, the governor must consult with the child’s mother and the Child and Family Agency as to the appropriate placement for the child
Sula nglactar leanbh amach ó phríosún, ní mór don ghobharnóir dul i gcomhairle le máthair an linbh agus leis an nGníomhaireacht um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach maidir leis an socrúchán cuí don leanbh
Prisoners do not have a right to smoke except in accordance with rules laid down by the governor
Níl an ceart ag príosúnaigh chun tobac a chaitheamh seachas i gcomhréir leis na rialacha a leagann an gobharnóir síos

You can find further information on prisoners' rights in the publication, Know Your Rights: Your Rights as a Prisoner produced jointly by the Irish Council for Civil Liberties and the Irish Penal Reform Trust

Féadfaidh tú teacht ar bhreis faisnéise ar chearta príosúnach sna foilseacháin a leanas: Bíodh Eolas Agat ar do Chearta: Do Chuid Ceart mar Phríosúnach ar chuir Comhairle na hÉireann um Shaoirsí Sibhialta agus Iontaobhas na hÉireann um Athchóiriú an Chórais Choiriúil i dtoll a chéile
